results.title: Voices on the Page: David Williamson
results.creator_credit: Peter Jennings, Ian Walker and Malcolm Otton
results.brief_description: The “Compulsive Playwright” provides you with a unique insight into the man and his work. His early experience, the problems of writing for film (Gallipoli), lecturing to students on the writing process, and rehearsing with the actors, are all part of this entertaining and informative video. This package has been designed for students of literature everywhere. It has a particular application for students studying senior English at Years 11 and 12 and tertiary institutions. Study guide included.

results.title: Kakadu: land of the crocodile (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Val Plumwood, environmental philosopher returns to Kakadu, where she was the victim of a crocodile attack. Against the backdrop of the steamy, intensely beautiful Kakadu National Park, viewers share her thoughts on wilderness and wildlife.

results.title: The Australian Alps: Mirka's Palace of Dreams (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Bill Murphy, David Greig, David Morgan and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
This program is the last in a series of six documentaries that examine the wilderness areas of Australia. Mirka Mora is an eccentric artist, French by birth, who had never before ventured into the wilderness nor slept in a tent. Along with Tim McCartney Snape, the first Australian ever to reach the summit of Mt. Everest, and a Nepalese Sherpa, she travels into the Kosciusko wilderness. Mirka’s unique and expressive personality helps viewers see and experience this wilderness from an artist’s perspective.
results.title_for_label: The Australian Alps: Mirka’s Palace of Dreams (Captioned)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Murphy, David Greig, David Morgan and Kestrel Film Productions

results.title: My Urban Garden
results.creator_credit: Les Halman, Polly Bennell and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A practical guide with some “helpful hints” on how to plan your own urban vegetable garden. This will appeal to all gardening enthusiasts and possibly even inspire those who have never tried.

results.title: First contact
results.creator_credit: Stewart Young, Dick Smith Adventure, Robin Anderson, Bob Connolly and Arundel Productions
results.brief_description: Documents the clash of two cultures that occurred in the 1930s when the people of the highlands of New Guinea encountered the first Europeans to enter their world. One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him.

constellations_other.name: Bob Connolly
constellations_other.description: Australian audiences just can't seem to get enough of exploring local governments, bureaucracy and politics, whether that's through documentaries or biting social satire.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Stewart Young, Dick Smith Adventure, Robin Anderson, Bob Connolly and Arundel Productions
results.description: Documents the clash of two cultures that occurred in the 1930s when the people of the highlands of New Guinea encountered the first Europeans to enter their world - for an El Dorado. One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him, and so managed to capture on film the confrontation between one civilisation and the representatives of another.
description_for_label: Documents the clash of two cultures that occurred in the 1930s when the people of the highlands of New Guinea encountered the first Europeans to enter their world - for an El Dorado. One of these Australians, Michael Leahy, took a movie camera with him, and so managed to capture on film the confrontation between one civilisation and the representatives of another.

results.title: The Desert hopping mouse
results.creator_credit: David Corke and Educational Media International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Web of life”.
Focuses on the spinifex hopping mouse of inland Australia to illustrate the many features it possesses which enable it to survive in what appears to be an extremely hostile environment. Also shows its daily activities, its methods of reproduction and the ways in which these may change with the seasons or from year to year. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: In your hands: hygiene in the food industry
results.creator_credit: Catherine Murphy, Rodney Land and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Highlights aspects of food handling which are the personal responsibility of the food handler. Discusses the sources of potentially hazardous bacteria and the various means by which these bacteria may be transferred to food.

results.title: Dean and Donna
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Martyn Down, Sandra Richardson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”.
Part of a series designed to facilitate discussion of various issues and themes related to social education, human relations and personal development and designed for use with primary-school and lower secondary school children in the 8 to 14 year age range. This part looks at Donna and Dean who are learning to adjust to different ‘blended family’ situations. Donna and her natural brother Scott have joined older brothers and sisters. Donna is now no longer the eldest. Dean lives with his father and new step-mother. They have recently had a baby. Explores the feelings they express while they are seeking to make the necessary readjustments.

results.title: Sean and Joel
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Martyn Down, Sandra Richardson, Ian Monroe, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”.
Sean and Joel realise that their father has left home for good. He has remarried and the boys have stayed with their single mother. Their feelings about their new situation are revealed as they learn to adjust to the aftermath of parental separation.

results.title: Going bush
results.creator_credit: Mike Woolveridge, Barry Pierce, Anne Whitehead and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Maps and Map Reading”.
If a bushwalking adventure is not to turn into some sort of nightmare then careful planning must be undertaken at the outset. Five bushwalkers plan all aspects of their four day walk before setting off into the wilderness. Suitable for upper secondary level.
